_meta.purpose: Prevent LLM hallucination of CJK etymologies
_meta.note: Only includes names with verified Korean meanings. Names not in this dictionary should not be claimed as Korean.

mae.notes: NOT 'maple' - that would be '단풍' (danpung). Often confused with Chinese 'Mei'.

mei.notes: Not Korean. Chinese origin meaning 'beautiful' (美). Sometimes confused with Korean names.

soo.notes: Common syllable in Korean names. Meaning depends on specific hanja character used.

jin.notes: Very common in both Korean and Chinese names. Multiple possible hanja characters.

min.notes: Common Korean name element. Also used in Chinese names.

hana.notes: Also means 'flower' in Japanese. Context matters for etymology claims.

yuna.notes: Popular modern Korean name. Also used as Japanese name with different kanji.

sora.notes: Also means 'sky' in Japanese. Be clear about which origin is meant.

mina.notes: Used in multiple cultures. Can be Korean, Japanese, or Arabic origin.

ara.notes: Pure Korean word meaning 'sea'. Also used as Arabic name meaning 'brings rain'.

nari.notes: Pure Korean word for lily flower.

bomi.notes: Pure Korean word, not based on Chinese characters.

hazel.notes: English name referring to hazel tree/nut. Not Korean.

rose.notes: English flower name. Not Korean. Note: Rose Park = Rosé from Blackpink.
